definition: Buddhist nun/(often used in phonetic spellings)
Slovakia/Slovak/abbr. for 斯洛伐克[Si1 luo4 fa2 ke4]

sentences.chinese: 丹尼斯冲男人大声吼道。

sentences.english: Dantes now left the piece of wood and began to swim to meet it.
sentences.chinese: 丹尼斯现在舍弃了那块破木板，开始向它游去。

sentences.english: That was what Dennis and Eckhardt were teaching.
sentences.chinese: 这就是丹尼斯和埃克哈特所要教的知识。

sentences.english: Hearing the name Monte Cristo, Dantes was filled with joy.
sentences.chinese: 一听到基度山的名称，丹尼斯内心充满喜悦。

sentences.english: On top of that, many investors were gun-shy about another Dennis comeback.
sentences.chinese: 丹尼斯再次回到交易界，这让很多投资者风声鹤唳。

sentences.english: We are no different from Ron Dennis at McLaren.
sentences.chinese: 我们和丹尼斯之于迈克拉伦没有区别。

sentences.english: " the judge asked, glancing at Dennis's lawyer, who lifted his eyebrows hopelessly.
sentences.chinese: 法官问道，瞥到丹尼斯的律师绝望地挑着眉。

sentences.english: The wild cross-section of his final Turtle picks demonstrated Dennis's diversity desires.
sentences.chinese: 这种交叉选择说明丹尼斯希望人要杂点。

sentences.english: I"m Dennis. I am here to meet you today.
sentences.chinese: 我是丹尼斯，今天我到这里来接你。

sentences.english: Some of the dog's decorative furnishings are carvings by Dennis & Frances.
sentences.chinese: 一些狗狗的装饰陈设是由丹尼斯与弗朗西斯雕刻的。

sentences.english: Denis himself doesn't work hard, however, he is always green-eyed of other people's achievements.
sentences.chinese: 丹尼斯自己不努力，还老是眼红别人的成就。

sentences.english: Dennis's suspicions of his wife smacked of midlife crisis.
sentences.chinese: 丹尼斯对妻子的怀疑带点中年危机的味道。

sentences.english: Now take back the soul of Denys George Finch Hatton, whom You have shared with us.
sentences.chinese: 现在，请收回丹尼斯的灵魂吧，你曾与我们分享他。

sentences.english: Has Dennis really taught a bazillion students?
sentences.chinese: 丹尼斯的学生真的不计其数吗？

sentences.english: Denis Wick offers silver-plated and gold-plated mouthpieces.
sentences.chinese: 丹尼斯维克提供镀银和镀金的号嘴。

definition: becquerel (unit of radioactivity, symbol Bq)/abbr. for 貝克勒爾|贝克勒尔[bei4 ke4 le4 er3]
Michel or Mitchell (name)/George Mitchell (1933-), US Democratic party politician and diplomat, influential in brokering Northern Ireland peace deal in 1990s, US Middle East special envoy from 2009
Clark T. Randt Jr. (1945-), US ambassador to Beijing 2001-2009
